header.title: CI/CD Setup Guide
header.description: Set up GitHub Actions to run your Endorphin AI tests automatically in CI/CD pipelines

quickSetup.title: Quick Setup (5 Minutes)
quickSetup.description: Get your tests running in CI with these simple steps

step2.title: Add OpenAI API Key Secret
steps: Navigate to Settings → Secrets and variables → Actions
Value: Your OpenAI API key (starts with sk-)

step3.title: Test Your Setup
step3.description: Your tests will now run automatically on every push and pull request!

multipleEnvironments.title: Multiple Environments
multipleEnvironments.description: Test against staging and production environments using matrix strategy.

scheduledTests.title: Scheduled Tests
scheduledTests.description: Run comprehensive tests nightly with cron scheduling.

targetedTesting.title: Targeted Testing
targetedTesting.description: Run different test suites based on tags and priorities.

costManagement.title: Cost Management
costManagement.description: Monitor token usage and implement cost controls.

environmentVariables.title: Environment Variables Reference
environmentVariables.description: Common environment variables for CI configuration

doThis.title: ✅ Do This
items: Store API keys in GitHub Secrets
Limit test execution to prevent costs

avoidThis.title: ❌ Avoid This
items: Never commit API keys to code
Don't run expensive tests on every PR
Avoid exposing sensitive data in logs

gettingStartedChecklist.title: Getting Started Checklist
gettingStartedChecklist.description: Follow this checklist to set up your CI/CD pipeline
items: Set up artifact upload for results

header.title: [DE] CI/CD Setup Guide
header.description: [DE] Set up GitHub Actions to run your Endorphin AI tests automatically in CI/CD pipelines

quickSetup.title: [DE] Quick Setup (5 Minutes)
quickSetup.description: [DE] Get your tests running in CI with these simple steps

step2.title: [DE] Add OpenAI API Key Secret
step2.steps: [DE] Go to your GitHub repository,Navigate to Settings → Secrets and variables → Actions,Click New repository secret,Name: OPENAI_API_KEY,Value: Your OpenAI API key (starts with sk-)

step3.title: [DE] Test Your Setup
step3.description: [DE] Your tests will now run automatically on every push and pull request!

multipleEnvironments.title: [DE] Multiple Environments
multipleEnvironments.description: [DE] Test against staging and production environments using matrix strategy.

scheduledTests.title: [DE] Scheduled Tests
scheduledTests.description: [DE] Run comprehensive tests nightly with cron scheduling.

targetedTesting.title: [DE] Targeted Testing
targetedTesting.description: [DE] Run different test suites based on tags and priorities.

costManagement.title: [DE] Cost Management
costManagement.description: [DE] Monitor token usage and implement cost controls.

environmentVariables.title: [DE] Environment Variables Reference
environmentVariables.description: [DE] Common environment variables for CI configuration

doThis.title: [DE] ✅ Do This
doThis.items: [DE] Store API keys in GitHub Secrets,Use environment-specific secrets,Rotate API keys regularly,Limit test execution to prevent costs,Use branch protection rules

avoidThis.title: [DE] ❌ Avoid This
avoidThis.items: [DE] Never commit API keys to code,Don't run expensive tests on every PR,Avoid running tests in forks,Don't skip timeout limits,Avoid exposing sensitive data in logs

gettingStartedChecklist.title: [DE] Getting Started Checklist
gettingStartedChecklist.description: [DE] Follow this checklist to set up your CI/CD pipeline
gettingStartedChecklist.items: [DE] Create .github/workflows/endorphin-tests.yml,Add OPENAI_API_KEY to GitHub Secrets,Configure endorphin.config.ts for CI,Test workflow with simple test,Add appropriate tags to tests,Set up artifact upload for results,Configure notifications for failures,Consider cost management
